item.title: Bitcoin Price Technical Analysis for 04/25/2016 - Aiming for $500? - NEWSBTC
item.description:
Bitcoin Price Technical Analysis for 04/25/2016 - Aiming for $500? - NEWSBTC

Bitcoin price could make its way to the 2015 highs near $500 if bulls continue to stay in control even with this week's event risks. Bitcoin Price Key Highlights Bitcoin price could make its way to the 2015 highs near $500 if bulls continue to stay in control even with this week's event risks.

item.title: The Crypto Show with Peter Todd, Manfred Karrer, Zhou Tonged and Brian Deery
item.description:
The Crypto Show with Peter Todd, Manfred Karrer, Zhou Tonged and Brian Deery

We talk with Manfred Karrer of Bitsquare.io the first 45 minutes. Bit square is the first decentralized crypto currency exchange. The exchange goes live April 27th in beta. Then we talk with Zhou Tonged about his Blockchain Party with Tatiana Moroz on May 2 2016 8pm to 1am at 266w 47th st in NYC.

item.title: What The South African Reserve Bank thinks of Bitcoin
item.description:
What The South African Reserve Bank thinks of Bitcoin

This got me thinking...India is going big on Bitcoin so what about asking suppliers in India if they will accept bitcoin in exchange for their imported products instead of following the often-times cumbersome Forex outward T/T procedures of the banks. Some banking systems could involve various steps to perform a foreign payment, and onerous document reporting requirements.

item.title: Bitcoin Price Moves Forward: $457 and Rising
item.description:
Bitcoin Price Moves Forward: $457 and Rising

Since our previous look at the bitcoin price, everybody's favorite coin has jumped another $14, bringing it to $457. What has once been described as a stagnant, slow and stuck in the middle entity is now rising faster than it has in quite some time, and digital currency enthusiasts are keeping their fingers crossed and hoping things last this way for quite a while.

item.title: New arrest in case of failed Bitcoin exchange Coin.mx
item.description:
New arrest in case of failed Bitcoin exchange Coin.mx

Another person involved in the operation of failed Bitcoin exchange Coin.mx has been arrested following the ongoing investigation by Federal Authorities into the case.

item.title: South African Reserve Bank Sees Potential For Real Bitcoin Growth
item.description:
South African Reserve Bank Sees Potential For Real Bitcoin Growth

It is always good to know how several banks around the world feel about Bitcoin, even though the outcome will be identical in most cases. The South African Reserve Bank does not consider Bitcoin and cryptocurrency legal tender, although that doesn't make usage of these currencies illegal.

item.title: Bitcoin Price Watch; Fresh Highs, Further Upside?
item.description:
Bitcoin Price Watch; Fresh Highs, Further Upside?

Here's what we are focusing on in the bitcoin price this morning - Monday, April 25. One thing we noticed on a number of occasions across the last few months, is the tendency for the weekly price to slow down towards the end of the week [Thursday, Friday] and then pick up some momentum over the weekend.

item.title: Report: Bitcoin is Legal in India
item.description:
Report: Bitcoin is Legal in India

There are certain guidelines as to who may issue legal tender and bank notes although neither of these terms has been clearly defined. There is a lot of concern across various countries in the world whether or not Bitcoin is legal in that particular region.

item.title: A Bitcoin Exchange Just Got Approval to Operate Across the EU
item.description:
A Bitcoin Exchange Just Got Approval to Operate Across the EU

Fifteen months ago, hackers lifted more than $5 million from the bitcoin exchange operated by Bitstamp, a Slovenian company that aspired to push the digital currency across Western Europe. The hack wasn't nearly as large or as devastating as the one that pilfered $460 million from Mt.

item.title: Steam to Accept Payments via Bitcoin in its Next Update
item.description:
Steam to Accept Payments via Bitcoin in its Next Update

The team behind Steam, a digital distribution platform developed by Valve Corporation offering digital rights management, multiplayer gaming and social networking services, has announced that the platform will officially begin to accept payments via bitcoin. CoinTelegraph has reached out to Bitpay for more information about their partnership with Steam.
